page.title: 15Gourdon Wedding Customs
page.content: When a couple are to be married they often have to undergo a{"blackening" ritual usually carried out on their last day at work prior to being married. The custom is that they are captured by workmates and friends and blackened with{oil, treacle or shoe {polish.}Then they are either put on a vehicle or walked through the streets, often accompanied by bell ringing and very often ending up in the water. Quite a number of womenfolk turn out to see a wedding when the bride or groom are well known in the area and well wishers{throw confetti}over the happy couple after the wedding ceremony. It is also the custom for the bride's father to{throw coins}from his taxi onto the road for the local children who have gathered to scramble for amongst themselves.
